item.title: Recipe 1: How To Grayscale The Screen
item.description: An image can be broken down into two components: the Chroma (Color) and the Luma (Brightness). if we desaturate an image completely (remove color), what is left is the Grayscaled version of that image. some people might refer to grayscale as “black and white”, however that’s not a technically accurate term for that. black and white would suggest that all the pixels of the image is either black or white, the image would be made of only 2 colors (Binary Image).

item.title: Recipe 2: How To Create Vignette
item.description: a red tinted vignette effect Vignette is a technique used to draw the attention to the center of the image by darkening or blurring the corners or edges (towards the periphery) of the frame. this effect is often used to create a more dramatic or cinematic look. How It Works? To create a vignette effect our fragment shader runs for every pixel and darkens it based on it’s distance from the center of the screen.
